meanings.definition: The act of fixing or attaching something firmly in place.
meanings.sent1: His infixations of the picture frame were so strong that it never fell.
meanings.sent2: The infixations of the wheels on the car ensured a smooth ride.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her infixations of the bookshelf made it look like a museum exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The infixations of the roots into the soil symbolized stability and growth.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's infixations of the shelves were precise and secure.

meanings.definition: The state of being firmly fixed or attached.
meanings.sent1: The infixations of the rope to the pole were strong enough to hold a flag.
meanings.sent2: The infixations of the tent pegs kept the tent secure in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The infixations of the magnets on the fridge made them seem like they had a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: The infixations of the vines on the wall created a beautiful natural tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The infixations of the glue on the paper were so tight that it was hard to separate them.

meanings.definition: The process of inserting something into something else.
meanings.sent1: The infixations of the key into the lock were smooth and effortless.
meanings.sent2: The infixations of the USB drive into the computer allowed for data transfer.
meanings.sent3: He found the infixations of the puzzle pieces oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The infixations of the needle into the fabric created intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The infixations of the coins into the piggy bank marked the start of saving.
